title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 301.9 - Request for additional information or documents
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 301.9 - Request for additional information or documents

State Regulations
(a) A party, by application in writing to the administrator, may request the arbitrator to direct the other party to produce any documents or
information. The arbitrator shall, upon receiving such request, or on his or her own initiative, direct the production of documents or information
which she or he believes will reasonably assist a party in presenting his or her case or assist the arbitrator in deciding the case. The arbitrator's
direction for the production of documents and information shall allow a reasonable time for the gathering and production of such documents and
information. (b) All documents and information forwarded in compliance with the arbitrator's direction
shall be legible and received no later than three business days prior to the date of the hearing. Each party shall bear its own photocopying
costs. (c) Upon failure of a party to comply with the arbitrator's direction to produce documents and/or
information, the arbitrator may draw a negative inference concerning any issue involving such documents or information. (d) The term documents in this section shall include, but not be limited to, relevant manufacturer's service
bulletins, dealer work orders, diagnoses, bills, and all communications relating to the consumer's claim. (e) At the request of either party or on his or her own initiative, the arbitrator, when she or he believes it
appropriate, may subpoena any witnesses to appear or documents to be presented at the hearing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
301.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
